entities.name: LANGUAGES
entities.description: A broad category of human communication systems, which can face extinction due to various factors

entities.name: CULTURAL ASSIMILATION AND GLOBALIZATION
entities.description: The process by which smaller, minority languages are marginalized and replaced by dominant languages like English, Spanish, and Mandarin

entities.name: DECLINE IN INTERGENERATIONAL TRANSMISSION
entities.description: The process where younger generations no longer learn or use their ancestral languages, leading to the risk of language disappearance

entities.name: ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS
entities.description: Factors such as natural disasters, wars, and forced migration that can lead to the displacement of communities and the death of their languages

entities.name: LOSS OF TRADITIONAL KNOWLEDGE
entities.description: The erosion of traditional ecological knowledge, spiritual beliefs, and social structures that are embedded in languages, contributing to language extinction

entities.name: LINGUISTIC DIVERSITY
entities.description: The variety of languages spoken around the world, which is threatened by language extinction

entities.name: LANGUAGE REVITALIZATION PROGRAMS
entities.description: Initiatives aimed at documenting, revitalizing, and promoting endangered languages through teaching, community engagement, and resource creation

entities.name: LINGUISTS
entities.description: Experts who study languages and work on documenting and preserving endangered languages

entities.name: LANGUAGE ACTIVISTS
entities.description: Individuals who advocate for the preservation and revitalization of endangered languages

entities.name: COMMUNITY MEMBERS
entities.description: People within a community who participate in efforts to preserve and revitalize their language

entities.name: SPANISH
entities.description: One of the dominant languages that contributes to the marginalization of minority languages through cultural assimilation and globalization

entities.name: MANDARIN
entities.description: One of the dominant languages that contributes to the marginalization of minority languages through cultural assimilation and globalization

entities.name: INDIGENOUS LANGUAGES
entities.description: Minority languages that are often marginalized and at risk of extinction due to cultural assimilation and globalization

entities.name: TRADITIONAL ECOLOGICAL KNOWLEDGE
entities.description: Knowledge and practices embedded in languages that are at risk of being lost with the extinction of those languages

entities.name: SPIRITUAL BELIEFS
entities.description: Beliefs and practices embedded in languages that are at risk of being lost with the extinction of those languages

entities.name: SOCIAL STRUCTURES
entities.description: Social systems and practices embedded in languages that are at risk of being lost with the extinction of those languages

entities.name: IDENTITY
entities.description: The sense of self and community that is often tied to language and is at risk of being eroded with the loss of a language

entities.name: SELF-ESTEEM
entities.description: The personal and communal sense of worth that can be negatively impacted by the loss of a language

entities.name: WELL-BEING
entities.description: The overall health and happiness of individuals and communities that can be negatively impacted by the loss of a language
